title: Trump Bows to Reality on Epstein Files Vote, in a Rare Retreat
summary: Faced with a mass defection on a bill to demand the release of the Epstein files, the president rushed to avoid an embarrassing loss, suggesting a slip in his iron grip on the G.O.P.

title: Larry Summers to Step Back From Public Commitments Over Epstein Emails
summary: New emails showed that Lawrence H. Summers, a former Harvard president, had stayed in touch with Jeffrey Epstein for years after Mr. Epstein faced sex trafficking charges.

title: House Is Expected to Vote on Tuesday to Release Epstein Files
summary: Ahead of what was likely to be a unanimous House vote that Republican leaders had toiled to avoid, G.O.P. lawmakers embraced the Epstein transparency bill.

title: Trump Has the Power to Release the Epstein Files. Why Doesn’t He?
summary: The president has reversed himself and encouraged lawmakers to vote for compelling the Justice Department to turn over investigation documents, but he never really needed their approval.

title: The Trump Family’s Saudi Business Ties, and Hundreds of Gazans on Mystery Flights
summary: Plus, a vote on the Epstein files.

title: Palestinian Voices Absent from U.S.-Run Center Planning Gaza’s Future
summary: U.S. and Israeli soldiers, foreign diplomats and aid workers are congregated in a warehouse in central Israel to talk about the future of Gaza. One key group is missing: Palestinians.

title: Too Powerful to Ignore, Saudi Prince Returns to Washington’s Embrace
summary: Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is to visit the White House on Tuesday for the first time since 2018, when the killing of a journalist by Saudi agents made him a pariah.

title: How Much Sex, Drugs and Violence Can Be in a PG-13 Movie?
summary: The movie ratings board has pulled back the curtain on how it approaches hot-button topics, including nudity, marijuana and guns.

title: When the G.O.P. Medicaid Cuts Arrive, These Hospitals Will Be Hit Hardest
summary: Republicans created a special $50 billion fund to help rural hospitals stay afloat, but the biggest impacts may be in cities.

title: Where Mao’s Peasants Tilled the Soil, Tourists Now Pay for the View
summary: Decades ago, a Chinese village became an official symbol of revolutionary “self-reliance.” The slogan hasn’t changed, but nearly everything else has.

title: Poor Countries Got $1 Trillion From China. So Did Rich Ones.
summary: Beijing has used loans to developing nations to expand its influence, but a new study says no country has received more Chinese financing than the United States.

title: Greenpeace Faces an Unusual New Legal Attack From a Pipeline Giant
summary: The company that won a huge verdict against Greenpeace earlier this year has asked a North Dakota court to block a countersuit in the Netherlands.

title: After Climate Push, Energy Companies Return to Fossil Fuels in Europe
summary: Recent oil and gas deals in Europe suggest that the growing demand for energy may be leading companies to adopt a more pragmatic approach.

title: Paramount, Comcast and Netflix Prepare Bids for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Paramount, Comcast and Netflix are preparing bids to buy all or part of Warner Bros. Discovery, a crown jewel of the industry.

title: The Fed Is Cutting Bank Oversight. Critics See Risks.
summary: The regulator is cutting staff and easing oversight in ways that critics say might make supervisors less equipped to spot a crisis in advance, risking deeper damage to the economy.

title: House Democrats Press for Vote to Bar Military Action in Venezuela
summary: The effort would invoke the War Powers Act, which expedites action on measures limiting the president’s war-making authority. It faces long odds in the G.O.P.-led House.

title: She Has Taken 30 Years to Write a 7-Part Novel About 1 Day. It’s a Sensation.
summary: The Danish author Solvej Balle’s experimental opus reframes the tedium of contemporary life as a source of unexpected wonders.

title: A City Is Broke. Can a Billionaire’s Urbanist Dream Offer It a Last Chance?
summary: Suisun City has tried to revive its fortunes for years. The latest idea: Annex land for California Forever, a tech-billionaire-funded new city plan north of San Francisco.

title: A Voyage Into the Art of Finding One’s Way at Sea
summary: Scientists and Indigenous sailors in the Marshall Islands are studying seafaring and the human brain.

title: The Democrat Who Split MAGA Over the Epstein Files
summary: Ro Khanna argues that even though there is a risk in releasing the documents, it still needs to happen.

title: Anorexia Was My Revolt Against Mother Nature
summary: My sister and I went on a joint diet. She stopped and I didn’t.

title: Tanzania: What to Know About the Post-Election Violence
summary: Post-election violence has tarnished the country’s reputation for stability, and the crackdown may have backfired on the government, as officials in Washington call for a re-examination of U.S. ties.

title: The Internet Loves Peptide Therapy. Is It Really a Miracle Cure?
summary: A suite of products promise smoother skin, bigger muscles and longer life. But what are peptides? And do they work?

title: C.D.C. Links Measles Outbreaks in Multiple States for First Time
summary: If the outbreaks cannot be extinguished by January, the anniversary of the first cases in Texas, the United States will lose what is known as “elimination status” as determined by the World Health Organization.
